page.title: 11 MASHAM SCHOOL
page.content: Masham C.E. Aided Primary School was once two schools- the Grammar School and the Free School founded in 1760 by the owner of Swinton,Lord of the Manor,Wiliam Danby. There is an inscription dating back to 1834 which says that William Danby's second wife, Mrs Danby Harcourt partly rebuilt it and enlarged it. Several gifts of land and money were made to provide for the instruction of 35 poor children in the parish at the Free School.The Grammar School was intended for the sons of rich people who could afford to pay 'head money' in return for 'sound moral,religious and liberal education.' Today,there are 110 pupils at the school with 4 full time teachers:Mr. Morgan,the Headmaster, Miss Hird Dep. Head,Mrs.Rutherford & Mr.Hawkshaw.Mrs. Todd is the part time(9hrs) teacher.
